DataElement.preferredName: Person Hispanic or Latino Ethnicity Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A textual description of the Hispanic or Latino ethnic group category.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being's indication of being a person of Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban, Central or South American or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race,

Property.preferredDefinition: Populations of Spanish, Portuguese, or Latin American descent residing in countries other than the country of their origin. (PSY94):Ethnicity is the cultural characteristics based on social and cultural backgrounds that connect a particular group or groups of people to each other.

Concepts.definition: A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race. The term, "Spanish origin" can be used in addition to "Hispanic or Latino". (OMB)
Ethnicity is the cultural characteristics based on social and cultural backgrounds that connect a particular group or groups of people to each other.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hispanic or Latino Ethnic Group Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race. The term, "Spanish origin" can be used in addition to "Hispanic or Latino". (OMB)_A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Members share a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences. They often have a common genetic heritage which may be reflected in their experience of health and disease._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denotes a person from the area between north and south America including persons from Belize, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, Panama, and the Panama Canal zone.

Concepts.definition: Denotes a person from the area between north and south America including persons from Belize, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, Panama, and the Panama Canal zone.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person of Cuban culture or origin, regardless of race.

Concepts.definition: A person of Cuban culture or origin, regardless of race.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denotes a person from the Dominican Republic or of that ancestry.

Concepts.definition: Denotes the inhabitants of the Dominican Republic, a person from there, or their descendants elsewhere.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denotes a person from or of Mexico.

Concepts.definition: Denotes a person from or of Mexico.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An island between the Caribbean Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean, east of the Dominican Republic. (CIA World Factbook 2002)

Concepts.definition: An island between the Caribbean Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean, east of the Dominican Republic and west of the British Virgin Islands.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: South America is a continent of the western hemisphere with most of its area in the southern hemisphere.  It is situated between the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean and is attached at the north to North America by the Isthmus of Panama.

Concepts.definition: South America is a continent of the western hemisphere with most of its area in the southern hemisphere.  It is situated between the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean and is attached at the north to North America by the Isthmus of Panama.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race. The term, "Spanish origin" can be used in addition to "Hispanic or Latino". (OMB):A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Members share a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences. They often have a common genetic heritage which may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Members share a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences.
